channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Author leaps barriers to write bestsellers
item.description: Kaipara author Steff Green discovered a way to live her dream writing bestselling paranormal, romance and fantasy novels

item.title: 'We got stuck!' -Couple stranded in Falklands close to home after hitching a ride on a ship
item.description: A newly-wed Auckland couple who were stranded in the Falkland Islands for four months are almost home, thanks to a lift from a fishing vessel.

item.title: Police officer injured by fleeing vehicle in Huntly
item.description: A police officer has been injured after a vehicle struck him while he was laying tyre spikes.

item.title: Politicians, journalists rated NZ's least trusted figures
item.description: Trust in politicians remains low, with only 22 per cent of New Zealanders giving them the thumbs up in recent polls.

item.title: Three new cases of Covid-19 reported in New Zealand today
item.description: There have been three new cases of Covid-19 reported in managed isolation, and while there were more tests carried out yesterday than previous weekends, the Health Ministry wants a larger increase in testing numbers.

item.title: Rakitū Island declared predator free after rats eradicated
item.description: Rakitū Island in the Hauraki Gulf has been declared predator free.

item.title: Man who died after fleeing from Hastings police had taser fired at him during assault on officer
item.description: A man who died in Hastings after suffering a "medical event" while fleeing from police had a taser fired at him while allegedly attacking an officer.

item.title: Police want to hear from person who stopped to help after motorbike crash
item.description: Police in Bay of Plenty want to hear from a person in a red truck who stopped to help, when two motorbikes crashed south of Whakatāne on Friday.

item.title: Man hands over climate change hunger strike after 21 days
item.description: A Christchurch father of three who has been on a hunger strike for 21 days will today hand the baton over to another protester.

item.title: Health checks for residents near Paritutu chemical plant a 'sham'
item.description: The Ministry of Health has provided 4062 health checks to people who lived or went to school within 1200 metres of a controversial chemical plant in New Plymouth.

item.title: Meth lab busts on the rise as pandemic hits drug imports
item.description: The closure of New Zealand's borders due to the Covid-19 pandemic has forced criminals to rethink supply lines for hard drugs, says a sociologist and organised crime expert.

item.title: Chatham Islands gets government funding for coronavirus recovery
item.description: The government will spend almost $40 million helping revitalise the Chatham Island's economy, which has been hard hit by the pandemic.

item.title: Eastern police find missing man
item.description: Eastern Police have found a 31-year-old man, after raising concerns he had not been seen since 18 July.

item.title: Loneliness spikes among New Zealand youth
item.description: Prolonged loneliness has hit high levels in New Zealand, particularly among young people, according to a new report.

item.title: Councils miss deadline for identifying quake-prone buildings
item.description: Two councils have missed a key deadline for identifying earthquake-prone buildings.

item.title: Covid-19 update: Two new cases reported in New Zealand today
item.description: There were two new cases of Covid-19 reported in managed isolation today, while the Health Ministry says it has spoken to a woman who tested positive after travelling from NZ to Australia.

item.title: Trial ferry service from Pukete to central Hamilton set to begin
item.description: Hamilton residents will soon have a new way to get to work - up the Waikato River.

item.title: Modern slavery rife in NZ and Pacific Islands, charity claims
item.description: One in 150 people are living in "modern slavery" in New Zealand, Australia and the Pacific Islands, according to a new report by a human rights charity.
